abstract: The dirty secret of debates is that, for all the reporters who descend on each town for each verbal sparring match, they really can be covered just well as on television.
snippet: The dirty secret of debates is that, for all the reporters who descend on each town for each verbal sparring match, they really can be covered just well as on television.
lead_paragraph: The list of great moments in political debates is long and well-trod - Ronald Reagan bellowing "I'm paying for this microphone," Lloyd Bentsen putting down Dan Quayle with his "Senator, you're no Jack Kennedy" line and, more recently, Barack Obama informing Hillary Rodham Clinton that she was "likable enough."

headline.main: A Look at the Debates, Beyond the Big Moments
